title: Permanent Ban
body:
So in the game lobby one of my teammates banned another teammate's champ by accident. He was supposed to be jungle and so he went to my lane, which was top, and fed. I asked people to report him after game and he reported me after the game and I got perma-banned. I have played on this account for years and invested so much time, only to be banned because of someone who can't handle their champ being banned and then acting like a ten year old. What is Riot as a community saying, that this kind of behavior is acceptable and fine? And that me being upset about someone not only taking my lane, but also intentionally feeding means a permanent ban? I've only had one temporary ban before and then this right away? It seems extremely unfair to me that a player like that gets to get away with this while I get my account which I've had for years, get banned.

Edit: Here's chat logs. Yeah I swore and got pissed off. Reason I posted was isn't it supposedly 4 bans before a perma-ban? And honestly it's just shitty to lose an account 109 levels in for this kind of bs. The CAPS part was gp crapping on me cause his WW got banned. (I wasn't the one who banned it and teammate said it was an accident)

replies.body: Report dont stack at all. 1 report is equal to 9 reports. Can you bring us the chat logs? (UNEDIT CHAT LOG)

> I asked people to report

Why? Why not do it yourself? It can be considered harassment and you likely got off a 14-day ban. They WARNED you your next punishment would be perma.

>What is Riot as a community saying, that this kind of behavior is acceptable and fine?

Wrong.

Normally I'd agree, but in this instance it seems all OP did was ask for a report (at least, assuming that's all OP did). And since the rules aren't really all in one place, I suspect a large percentage (probably even a majority) of players have no idea that asking for other players to report someone is considered harassment, especially since it's frequently done in games, and with a cordial manner and non-malicious intent.

If there were better transparency and accessibility to Riot's policies, I'd agree with you, but as is a permaban for asking for players to report someone seems overly harsh in this specific case.

The purpose to ask for report is to get someone punished and you are asking in front of that person.  Hard to find non-malicious intent out of that, at least from the person being reported point of view who likely to counter-report you.
So I have malicious intent if I report someone for telling someone to kill themselves?

If you report yourself quietly? no

If you continuously ask other people to report that person, what other intent do you have but to try to get that person punished?  The person being toxic doesn't give you the right to be toxic yourself.  1 report = 9 reports.

I know that 1 report=9 reports. I don't think that knowledge is as common among the general player base as it is among those who frequent this board, or boards in general. As I said in my earlier post, I suspect most players have no idea that asking for other players to report someone is considered harassment, and that most players also think that more reports increases the chances of that person being punished. I think Riot needs to do a better job of educating players on that subject before they start banning for that and that alone.

Yeah, LoL is in a shitty place right now. It's far worse than a few years ago. I blame that primarily of the addition of keystone masteries and later the new rune system, though I'm not a fan of the increasingly draconian punishments, either.

My point with the post you replied to is to give you Riot's position on the subject, since they're the one with the power here. And from their position, they don't care what someone did to provoke you. If you exhibit behavior they've banned for any reason and you're reported, you will be punished. That's why it generally doesn't matter whether chat logs show the chat of the other players or not.
